intro: Malesherbia gabrielae, commonly known as the Gabriel's malesherbia, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and elliptical leaves. It produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
